metadata.based_on: ACOG Clinical Consensus 2025, ADA Standards of Care 2025

protocols.name: First-Time Mothers (Primigravida) Protocol
protocols.description: Comprehensive interview protocol for women experiencing their first pregnancy (G1P0). Emphasizes education, expectation setting, and foundation building.

target_criteria.applies_to: First-time pregnant individuals regardless of risk level

interview_structure.follow_up_frequency: Every 4 weeks until 28 weeks, then every 2 weeks

objectives: Set comfortable tone for sensitive topics

questions.text: How are you feeling about your pregnancy today?
follow_up_prompts: What emotions have been strongest for you?
Is there anything that's been particularly exciting or worrying?

questions.text: What questions or concerns do you have about your pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: Are there specific topics you'd like to learn more about?
Have you been able to find reliable information?

questions.text: Do you have any chronic health conditions or take any regular medications?
follow_up_prompts: How well controlled is this condition?
Have you discussed your medications with your provider during pregnancy?

questions.text: Have you had any complications or health concerns so far in this pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: When did this start?
Have you contacted your healthcare provider about this?

questions.text: Are you experiencing any pregnancy symptoms? Which ones have been most challenging?
questions.purpose: Assess symptom burden and provide guidance
follow_up_prompts: How are these symptoms affecting your daily life?
Have you found anything that helps?

questions.text: Was this pregnancy planned?
follow_up_prompts: How do you feel about being pregnant now?
Do you have support from your partner/family?

questions.text: Are you taking prenatal vitamins with folic acid?
follow_up_prompts: How long have you been taking them?
Do you have any trouble taking them (nausea, cost, access)?

questions.text: Who do you have for support during this pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: Is your partner involved and supportive?
Do you have family or friends you can rely on?

questions.text: Do you currently smoke, or have you smoked during this pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: How many cigarettes per day?
Have you thought about quitting or cutting down?
Would you like help with smoking cessation?

questions.text: Do you drink alcohol or use any recreational substances?
follow_up_prompts: When did you last use?
How often do you typically use?
Do you need support to stop using?

questions.text: Tell me about your typical diet. Do you have any concerns about nutrition?
follow_up_prompts: Are you eating regular meals?
Do you have access to healthy food?
Any food aversions or cravings?

questions.text: Are you able to exercise or stay physically active?
follow_up_prompts: What types of activities do you enjoy?
Are there any barriers to being active?

objectives: Identify need for mental health referral

questions.text: Over the past two weeks, how often have you felt down, depressed, or hopeless?
follow_up_prompts: How long have you felt this way?
Have you had professional support for mental health before?
Do you feel safe discussing this further?

questions.text: Over the past two weeks, how often have you had little interest or pleasure in doing things?
follow_up_prompts: What activities used to bring you joy?
Do you have support at home?

questions.text: What are your main sources of stress right now?
follow_up_prompts: How are you coping with these stresses?
What would be most helpful right now?

questions.text: Do you feel safe in your current living situation?
follow_up_prompts: Are you being hurt or threatened by anyone?
Do you have somewhere safe to go if needed?

objectives: Screen for social drivers of health

questions.text: Do you have health insurance that covers prenatal care and delivery?
follow_up_prompts: What type of insurance do you have?
Are you having any difficulty accessing care or affording medications?

questions.text: Do you have reliable transportation to get to appointments?
follow_up_prompts: How far do you have to travel for care?
Would you like information about transportation assistance?

questions.text: Do you have stable housing?
follow_up_prompts: Are you worried about losing your housing?
Do you need help finding housing resources?

questions.text: In the last month, have you worried about having enough food for yourself or your family?
follow_up_prompts: How often do you worry about food?
Would you like information about food assistance programs?

questions.text: Have you thought about your preferences for labor and delivery?
follow_up_prompts: What are your main concerns about labor and delivery?
Would you like information about childbirth classes?

questions.text: Are you planning to breastfeed?
follow_up_prompts: What have you heard about breastfeeding?
Do you have questions or concerns about feeding your baby?

objectives: Summarize key points and action items

questions.text: What questions do you still have that we haven't covered?
Do you understand what warning signs to watch for and when to call?

protocols.name: Experienced Mothers (Multigravida) Protocol
protocols.description: Interview protocol for women with previous pregnancy experience. Builds on prior knowledge while addressing new or recurring concerns.

interview_structure.follow_up_frequency: Every 4 weeks until 28 weeks (may extend to 6-8 weeks if uncomplicated)

objectives: Identify concerns specific to this pregnancy

questions.text: How is this pregnancy different from your previous one(s)?
follow_up_prompts: Are the symptoms more or less severe?
Do you have different concerns this time?

questions.text: Was this pregnancy planned?
follow_up_prompts: How do you feel about being pregnant again?
How is your family adjusting?

questions.text: Tell me about your previous pregnancy/pregnancies. Were there any complications?
follow_up_prompts: How was this managed?
Do you have records from that pregnancy?
Are you concerned about this happening again?

questions.text: How did you deliver your previous baby/babies?
follow_up_prompts: Were there any complications during delivery?
How was your recovery?
If cesarean: What was the reason?

questions.text: Have you had any pregnancy losses, including miscarriages or stillbirths?
follow_up_prompts: How far along were you?
Was a cause identified?
Do you have concerns about this pregnancy?

questions.text: Did you breastfeed your previous child(ren)? For how long?
follow_up_prompts: How was that experience for you?
Are you planning to breastfeed this baby?
Do you need any support or resources?

questions.text: Have you developed any new health conditions since your last pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: When was this diagnosed?
How is it being managed?
Are you seeing a specialist?

questions.text: Are you taking any medications or supplements?
follow_up_prompts: Are you taking prenatal vitamins?
Have you discussed these medications with your doctor?

questions.text: How are you feeling physically in this pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: Any concerning symptoms?
How is this compared to before?

questions.text: Have your smoking, alcohol, or substance use habits changed since your last pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: Would you like support to quit or reduce use?
Do you understand the risks to your pregnancy?

questions.text: Are you able to maintain healthy eating and exercise habits with other children at home?
questions.purpose: Assess nutrition and activity with caregiving demands
follow_up_prompts: What are the biggest challenges?
Do you need help with meal planning or childcare to exercise?

questions.text: Did you experience postpartum depression or anxiety after your previous pregnancy?
questions.purpose: Assess risk for recurrent perinatal mood disorder
follow_up_prompts: How long did symptoms last?
Did you receive treatment?
Are you concerned about this happening again?

questions.text: How are you feeling emotionally about this pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: Any feelings of sadness, worry, or being overwhelmed?
How is your sleep (beyond normal pregnancy disruption)?
Do you have support at home?

questions.text: How is your other child/children adjusting to the news of a new baby?
follow_up_prompts: Have you prepared them?
Do you have concerns about managing multiple children?

objectives: Discuss delivery preferences based on history

questions.text: Based on your previous experience, what would you like to do the same or differently this time?
follow_up_prompts: What worked well before?
What would you change?
Do you have specific preferences for this delivery?

questions.text: If you had a previous cesarean, are you interested in attempting a vaginal birth (VBAC)?
follow_up_prompts: Have you discussed this with your provider?
Do you understand the risks and benefits?
What factors are important in your decision?

questions.text: Do you have childcare arranged for your appointments and when you deliver?
follow_up_prompts: Do you need help finding childcare resources?
Do you have support for after delivery?

questions.text: What resources or support would be most helpful for you right now?

immediate_referral: History of severe postpartum depression with current symptoms
History of pregnancy complications with similar symptoms
Multiple previous pregnancy losses with current bleeding/pain

protocols.name: High-Risk Pregnancy Protocol
protocols.description: Comprehensive protocol for pregnancies with increased maternal or fetal risk. Includes enhanced monitoring and specialist coordination.

interview_structure.follow_up_frequency: Every 2-4 weeks depending on risk level, specialist may see more frequently

objectives: Identify and document all risk factors

questions.text: I see you have [risk factor]. Can you tell me more about this condition and how it's been managed?
follow_up_prompts: When were you diagnosed?
What treatments have you tried?
Who manages this condition for you?
How well controlled is it currently?

questions.text: Are you seeing any specialists for your health conditions?
follow_up_prompts: Which specialists?
How often do you see them?
Have they been informed about your pregnancy?

questions.text: In your previous pregnancy, what complications did you experience?
complications_to_detail: Gestational diabetes - onset week, management, delivery timing
Preeclampsia - onset, severity, delivery timing, complications
Preterm birth - gestational age, cause if known

objectives: Review all medications for pregnancy safety
Coordinate with specialists on necessary medications

questions.text: Let's review all your current medications. What are you taking and how often?
follow_up_prompts: Has your doctor reviewed these for pregnancy safety?
Any medications that were stopped or changed?
Are you taking 400-800 mcg folic acid daily?

questions.text: For diabetes: How are you monitoring your blood sugars? What are your typical values?
questions.target_values: Fasting <95 mg/dL, 1-hour postprandial <140 mg/dL, 2-hour postprandial <120 mg/dL
follow_up_prompts: How often are you checking?
Are you having any lows or highs?
Do you have a glucose log to share?

questions.text: For hypertension: Are you monitoring your blood pressure at home?
follow_up_prompts: What are your typical readings?
Do you have a home BP monitor?
Any symptoms like headaches or vision changes?

objectives: Educate on high-risk specific warning signs

questions.text: Are you experiencing any of these symptoms: severe headaches, vision changes, upper abdominal pain, sudden swelling, decreased fetal movement?
questions.purpose: Screen for preeclampsia and other urgent conditions
questions.red_flags: Any positive response requires immediate evaluation
follow_up_prompts: When did this start?
How severe is it?
Have you contacted your doctor?

questions.text: For gestational diabetes history: Have you noticed increased thirst, frequent urination more than normal for pregnancy, or unusual fatigue?
follow_up_prompts: When will you have your glucose screening?
Are you following any dietary modifications?

questions.text: Are you having any contractions or cramping?
questions.applicable_if: History of preterm birth or current risk factors
follow_up_prompts: How often?
How long do they last?
Any other symptoms like back pain, pressure, or discharge?

questions.text: If past 28 weeks: Are you feeling regular fetal movement?
follow_up_prompts: When do you typically feel the baby move most?
Have you noticed any decrease in movement?
Do you know how to do kick counts?

questions.text: What fetal monitoring have you had or do you have scheduled?
follow_up_prompts: Do you understand why these tests are needed?
Do you have questions about the results?

questions.text: For diabetes: Are you following a diabetic diet? Have you met with a dietitian?
follow_up_prompts: What does a typical day of eating look like?
Are you having trouble with the diet?
Would you like to meet with a dietitian?

questions.text: For hypertension: Are you limiting sodium and following a heart-healthy diet?
follow_up_prompts: Do you know how to read nutrition labels?
What are your biggest challenges with the diet?

questions.text: What level of physical activity are you able to do?
follow_up_prompts: Have you been given any activity restrictions?
Are you able to do any gentle exercise?
Do you need guidance on safe exercise?

objectives: Screen for anxiety about high-risk status

questions.text: How are you coping with the stress of a high-risk pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: What worries you most?
What helps you manage anxiety?
Do you have adequate support?

questions.text: Are you experiencing symptoms of depression or anxiety?
follow_up_prompts: Would you like to talk to someone about these feelings?
Have you had mental health support before?

objectives: Clarify roles of care team members

questions.text: Let's make sure your care team is coordinated. Who are all the providers involved in your care?
follow_up_prompts: Are they communicating with each other?
Do you have all contact numbers?
Who should you call first if you have concerns?

questions.text: Do you understand your monitoring and testing schedule?
follow_up_prompts: Do you have all appointments scheduled?
Do you have transportation to frequent appointments?
Any barriers to keeping appointments?

objectives: Discuss timing and mode of delivery

questions.text: Have you discussed the likely timing and method of delivery with your doctor?
considerations: May need cesarean depending on risk factors
May need delivery at higher-level facility
follow_up_prompts: Do you understand why early delivery might be recommended?
What are your preferences within the safe options?
Do you have questions about what to expect?

questions.text: Where are you planning to deliver? Have you toured the facility?
follow_up_prompts: Does this facility have the level of care you need?
Is the NICU level appropriate if needed?

questions.text: What resources would help you manage your high-risk pregnancy?
Do you know the warning signs specific to your condition and when to seek immediate care?

urgent_specialist_referral: Maternal-fetal medicine if not already involved

fetal_surveillance: Non-stress tests weekly or twice weekly (third trimester)

protocols.name: Low Socioeconomic Status / Healthcare Access Barriers Protocol
protocols.description: Protocol tailored for individuals facing socioeconomic challenges and healthcare access barriers. Emphasizes resource connection and barrier reduction.

interview_structure.follow_up_frequency: Every 4 weeks with flexible scheduling, outreach if missed appointments

questions.text: Thank you for coming in today. What challenges did you face getting here?
follow_up_prompts: How can we make it easier for you to come to appointments?
Would different appointment times help?
Do you need help with transportation or childcare?

questions.text: What are your most pressing concerns or needs right now?
questions.purpose: Identify urgent needs to address first
follow_up_prompts: What would help you most right now?
Can we help you with any of these today?

questions.text: Do you have a place to live that is safe and stable?
follow_up_prompts: Are you worried about losing your housing?
Do you sometimes sleep in temporary or unstable situations?
Would you like help finding housing resources?

questions.text: In the last month, did you worry that your food would run out before you got money to buy more?
follow_up_prompts: In the last month, did the food you bought just not last?
Would you like help applying for food assistance?
Can we give you information about food resources today?

questions.text: How hard is it for you to pay for the very basics like food, housing, medical care, and heating?
follow_up_prompts: Are there bills you can't pay?
Do you ever have to choose between necessities?
Would you like to speak with a financial counselor?

questions.text: Do you have health insurance?
follow_up_prompts: Would you like help applying for insurance?
Do you know about pregnancy Medicaid?
Can we help you enroll today?

questions.text: Do you have reliable transportation to get to medical appointments?
follow_up_prompts: How do you usually get to appointments?
Have you missed appointments because of transportation?
Would you like information about free or low-cost transportation?

questions.text: Do you feel safe where you are living? Does anyone threaten or hurt you?
questions.purpose: Screen for intimate partner violence and safety
follow_up_prompts: Are you in danger now?
Do you have a safe place to go?
Would you like to talk to someone who can help?

questions.text: Do you have someone to turn to for support?
questions.resource_connection_if_no: Support groups, home visiting programs, community resources
follow_up_prompts: Is there someone who can help you during pregnancy and after birth?
Would you like to connect with other pregnant women or new moms?
Can we help you find support?

questions.text: When was your last healthcare visit before coming here?
follow_up_prompts: What prevented you from getting care sooner?
Do you have a regular doctor or clinic?
What makes it hard to get healthcare?

questions.text: Do you have any health conditions or take any medications?
questions.purpose: Identify medical issues and medication access
follow_up_prompts: Are you able to get your medications?
Have you had trouble affording medications?
Do you know about medication assistance programs?

questions.text: Is this your first pregnancy? Have you been pregnant before?
follow_up_prompts: Tell me about your previous pregnancies.
Were there any problems?
Did you receive prenatal care?

questions.text: When did you find out you were pregnant? How far along do you think you are?
questions.purpose: Determine gestational age and entry to care
follow_up_prompts: Have you had any prenatal care yet?
What prevented you from coming in earlier?
Have you had an ultrasound?

questions.text: Are you taking prenatal vitamins?
follow_up_prompts: What has stopped you from taking vitamins?
Can we give you vitamins today to take home?
Do you need help paying for vitamins?

sections.section_name: Substance Use and Mental Health Screening

questions.text: Do you smoke cigarettes?
follow_up_prompts: Have you tried to quit?
Would you like help quitting?
Can we connect you to a free quit program?

questions.text: Sometimes when people are under stress they use alcohol or other substances. Is that something you do?
follow_up_prompts: What do you use and how often?
When was your last use?
Would you like help to stop or cut down?
Have you tried treatment before?

questions.text: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you felt down, depressed, or hopeless?
follow_up_prompts: How long have you felt this way?
Have you had help for depression before?
Would you like to talk to a counselor?

questions.text: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you had little interest or pleasure in doing things?
follow_up_prompts: What makes it hard to enjoy things?
Do you have support?

questions.text: Do you feel you have adequate emotional support?
follow_up_prompts: Who can you talk to when you're stressed?
Would you like to meet with a social worker?
Are you interested in joining a support group?

questions.text: What do you know about what to expect during pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: Where have you gotten information about pregnancy?
What questions do you have?
Would you like information in a specific format (video, handout, app)?

questions.text: Do you know what warning signs to watch for in pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: Do you know who to call if you have these symptoms?
Here's a card with warning signs and our number to keep.

questions.text: What are your biggest questions or worries about pregnancy and having a baby?
follow_up_prompts: Let's talk about that.
We have resources that can help with that.

questions.text: Tell me about what you typically eat in a day.
follow_up_prompts: Are you able to eat regular meals?
What makes it hard to eat healthy?
Do you have a way to cook food?

questions.text: Have you heard of WIC - the nutrition program for pregnant women and babies?
questions.eligibility: Income ≤185% federal poverty level, pregnant, postpartum, or children <5
follow_up_prompts: Would you like help signing up today?
WIC provides free healthy food, nutrition education, and breastfeeding support.
We can help you apply right now.

questions.text: Do you have any cravings for non-food items like ice, dirt, or laundry starch?
follow_up_prompts: How often does this happen?
Let's check your iron levels.
This can be a sign you need more iron.

objectives: Connect to baby supplies and equipment

questions.text: Where are you planning to have your baby?
follow_up_prompts: Does your insurance work there?
Do you know how to get there?
Would you like to tour the facility?

questions.text: Who will be with you when you have the baby?
follow_up_prompts: Is there someone who can take you to the hospital?
Would you like information about free doula services?
Do you have someone to help after the baby is born?

questions.text: Do you have the things you'll need for the baby - like a car seat, crib, diapers, clothes?
questions.purpose: Assess preparation and connect to resources
questions.resource_connection: Baby pantries, community organizations, hospital programs
follow_up_prompts: What do you still need?
We have connections to programs that provide baby items.
Would you like help getting these things?

questions.text: Are you planning to breastfeed?
questions.purpose: Assess feeding intentions and provide support
follow_up_prompts: What do you know about breastfeeding?
We have lactation support available.
If you need formula, WIC can help with that.

objectives: Connect to all needed resources TODAY
Assign case manager or patient navigator

questions.text: Let's talk about what help we can connect you with today. What would be most helpful?
Would you like to work with a case manager who can help you navigate resources and appointments?
What phone number is best to reach you? Do you have reliable phone service?
questions.provide_phone_if_needed: Assess if patient needs phone/minutes assistance
follow_up_prompts: Can we text you reminders?
If we can't reach you, is there someone else we can call?
Do you check email?

objectives: Set up appointment reminders and support

questions.text: Let's schedule your next appointment. What days and times work best for you?
follow_up_prompts: Do you need a certain time because of work?
Do you need childcare or can you bring your children?
Do you need help with transportation?

questions.text: What would help you remember and be able to make it to your appointments?
questions.purpose: Identify and address barriers to follow-up
follow_up_prompts: Would you like text reminders?
Can we help arrange transportation?
Can we help with childcare?

questions.text: Do you understand everything we talked about today? Do you have any other questions?
follow_up_prompts: Can you tell me back what you'll do before next time?
Here's a summary of what we discussed and your next steps.
Who can you call if you have questions?

immediate_referral: Active domestic violence with safety concerns
case_management_required: Mental health or substance use concerns

resources_to_provide_today: Warning signs card with clinic phone number

care_coordination: Weekly case manager check-ins for high-need patients

protocols.name: Routine/Standard Prenatal Care Protocol
protocols.description: Protocol for low-risk pregnancies with good health access and preparation. Emphasizes wellness, education, and routine monitoring.

interview_structure.follow_up_frequency: Every 4 weeks until 28 weeks, every 2 weeks until 36 weeks, then weekly

questions.text: Congratulations! How are you feeling about your pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: Was this pregnancy planned?
How is your partner/family responding?
What are you most excited about? Any concerns?

questions.text: Have you been taking prenatal vitamins? How long?
follow_up_prompts: What brand/type are you taking?
Are you getting at least 400-800 mcg of folic acid?
Any trouble tolerating them?

questions.text: When was your last menstrual period? How regular are your cycles?
follow_up_prompts: When did you get a positive pregnancy test?
Do you know when you might have conceived?

questions.text: Do you have any chronic health conditions or ongoing health concerns?
follow_up_prompts: How is this condition managed?
Are you seeing a specialist?
Has your provider cleared your medications for pregnancy?

questions.text: Have you been pregnant before? If so, tell me about those pregnancies.
follow_up_prompts: Any complications?
How did you deliver?
How were your recoveries?
Did you breastfeed?

questions.text: Are you taking any medications, including over-the-counter or supplements?
follow_up_prompts: Have you discussed these with your provider?
Any medications you stopped when you found out you were pregnant?

questions.text: Is there any family history of genetic conditions, birth defects, or pregnancy complications?
follow_up_prompts: In your family or your partner's family?
What condition?
Have you considered genetic testing or counseling?

questions.text: Tell me about your typical diet and nutrition habits.
follow_up_prompts: Are you following any special diet?
Any food aversions or cravings?
Would you like to meet with a dietitian?

questions.text: What does your exercise routine look like?
follow_up_prompts: What types of exercise do you enjoy?
Are you planning to continue during pregnancy?
Do you have questions about safe exercise in pregnancy?

questions.text: Do you smoke, drink alcohol, or use any recreational substances?
follow_up_prompts: Have you stopped since finding out you're pregnant?
Do you need support to quit?
Do you understand the risks in pregnancy?

questions.text: What do you do for work? Are there any occupational exposures we should know about?
follow_up_prompts: Do you work with chemicals, radiation, or infectious materials?
Can we provide a letter for workplace accommodations if needed?

questions.text: How are you feeling emotionally? Any concerns about mood or anxiety?
follow_up_prompts: Any history of depression or anxiety?
How are you coping with stress?
Do you have adequate emotional support?

questions.text: Tell me about your support system. Who is helping you through this pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: Is your partner involved and supportive?
Do you have family or friends nearby?
Are there any relationship concerns?

questions.text: Do you feel safe in your relationship and home?
follow_up_prompts: Has anyone hurt you or made you feel unsafe?
Would you like to talk to someone privately about this?

questions.text: Have you thought about prenatal genetic screening and testing options?
follow_up_prompts: What do you know about these tests?
Do you have questions about what they screen for?
What are your preferences for testing?

questions.text: What questions do you have about pregnancy, labor, and delivery?
follow_up_prompts: Have you been reading or learning about pregnancy?
Are you interested in childbirth education classes?
What topics are you most interested in?

questions.text: Do you have preferences for your birth experience?
follow_up_prompts: What's most important to you?
Have you considered pain management options?
Would you like to create a birth plan?

questions.text: Do you understand the schedule for prenatal visits?
questions.provide_schedule: Monthly until 28 weeks, bi-weekly until 36 weeks, then weekly
follow_up_prompts: Do these times work with your schedule?
Any barriers to attending regular appointments?

questions.text: Do you know what warning signs to watch for and when to call?
follow_up_prompts: Do you have our after-hours number?
Do you know how to reach us with concerns?

questions.text: What other questions or concerns do you have?
follow_up_prompts: Is there anything we haven't covered that you'd like to discuss?

specialist_referral: Advanced maternal age (≥35) with desire for additional counseling
